message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CC, cs.Distributed Systems, cs.OS, cs.SE. 

The paper discusses the use of Amazon EC2 spot instances and the challenges associated with their reduced reliability. This suggests that the paper may belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses checkpointing and migration schemes, which are commonly used in distributed systems, further supporting the cs.DC sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses resource provisioning, which is a topic commonly studied in the Cloud Computing (cs.CC) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of application-centric frameworks, which may fall under the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the paper may also belong to the Operating Systems (cs.OS) sub-category, as it discusses the use of virtual instances and their management.
